parse.title: An Artist's Interpretation of Middle Earth

links.*: The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)

wikitext.*:
{{book |title=''An Artist's Interpretation of Middle Earth Including the Wild Lands - East, South & North'' | image = Pete Fenlon - Map of Middle-earth (large).jpg |author=[[Peter C. Fenlon]] (map, bordering and lettering)
Additional illustrations from the [[The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)|Motion Picture ''The Lord of the Rings'']] |illustrator=[[Peter C. Fenlon]] |contributors=Peter C. Fenlon and [[Terry K. Amthor]] (concept and design) |noisbn=None |publisher=[[Iron Crown Enterprises]] |date=[[1982]] |format=Poster |pages=1 |ice=2100 |amazonprice= }} '''An Artist's Interpretation of Middle Earth''' is a 24" x 36" color map for ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]'', 1st Edition. Beyond Tolkien's [[Middle-earth]], a large part of the map depicts newly invented areas that were featured in modules for the role-playing game. Peter Fenlon also wrote a gazetteer based on the geographical names used on the map. The gazetteer was only published by [[Iron Crown Enterprises|ICE]] on the internet and is now off-line. ==External links== * [http://web.archive.org/web/19980429095342/http://ironcrown.com/GamesInfo/MERP/Continent/Graphics/Endor.html Fenlon's descriptions of newly invented areas] (archived) [[Category:MERP maps]]
